fields.summary: Issue navigator should be consistent in giving the result

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
Accessing Audit Log page (_<Base_URL>/auditing/view_) throws a 500 error when connecting JIRA to *SQL Server 2012*.

(i) This doesn't affect MySQL or Postgre.

h4. +Environment+
JIRA 7.4 EAP01 Server (64-bit .EXE installer)
SQL Server 2012
Windows 10 Pro

h4. +Notes+
* The page tends to hang in IE11 and Edge without displaying the 500 error.
* In Chrome the error is displayed but *Request assistance* can't be expanded.
* The following error is thrown in the log:
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary

Commit message includes special character such as in this example, a hyphen included in the initial commit message
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create an applinks between JIRA and Fisheye.
 # Trigger a smart commit below: (hyphen is the special character)
{code:java}
- TEST-47 #comment corrected indent issue
{code}

 # Development Panel in JIRA issue will not shown any commits.

h3. Expected Results.

Smart commits should ignore any text or special characters before <ISSUE_KEY> as per our [doco|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+smart+commits]:
{code:java}
<ignored text> <ISSUE_KEY> <ignored text> #<COMMAND> <optional COMMAND_ARGUMENTS>
{code}
h3. Actual Results.

Development Panel is not showing but smart commits are working.
h3. Note

Tested in Fisheye 4.2.0 and 4.4.0
fields.summary: Development Panel will not shown if smart commits with a special character

fields.description:
* Apache has released the Apache Software Foundation Releases Security Updates:
 * [https://www.us-cert.gov/ncas/current-activity/2017/04/12/Apache-Software-Foundation-Releases-Security-Updates]

There are a few vulnerabilities reported:
 # CVE-2017-5648 - [http://mail-archives.us.apache.org/mod_mbox/www-announce/201704.mbox/%3C8a78e8fe-616e-1959-3c0e-26704fc72766@apache.org%3E]
 # CVE-2017-5650 - [http://mail-archives.us.apache.org/mod_mbox/www-announce/201704.mbox/%3C6d8077ef-1bcb-d07b-0bd0-f70ab0043faf@apache.org%3E]
 # CVE-2017-5651 - [http://mail-archives.us.apache.org/mod_mbox/www-announce/201704.mbox/%3C63a584ba-4db7-85d3-0206-c1164b9d26c6@apache.org%3E]
 # CVE-2016-6817 - [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-6817]
 # CVE-2016-6816 - [http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2016-6816]

For CVE-2017-5650 and CVE-2017-5651, the Severity is Important and:
{quote}Versions Affected:
 * *Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M18*
 * *Apache Tomcat 8.5.0 to 8.5.12*
 * Apache Tomcat 8.0.x and earlier are not affected{quote}
{quote}Users of the affected versions should apply one of the following
 mitigations:
 * *Upgrade to Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M19 or later*
 * *Upgrade to Apache Tomcat 8.5.13 or later*{quote}
(+) Moving forward, fix versions of JIRA should be bundled with Tomcat 8.5.13/9.0.0.M19 or above.
h5. Workaround

If Tomcat is to be manually upgraded, please refer to [How to upgrade Apache Tomcat version in JIRA 7.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+upgrade+Apache+Tomcat+version+in+JIRA+7.x]. Currently Tomcat 8.5.13 and 8.5.14 are available.

(!) Manually upgrading Tomcat is not recommended or supported.
fields.summary: Update bundled Apache Tomcat due to security vulnerabilities

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When a person in a different timezone views that exact same JQL, there can be different issues displayed if the JQL is dependent on dates.
 

h3. Suggestion

Add flexibility when saving a filter to use the time zone it was created in or have it fluctuate to whatever time zone it's run in. There are many remote teams that want to get the same results regardless of where they are located. 

Opening a new suggestion as some of the suggestions from the past were closed.

fields.description:
h1. Problem Definition

As an administrator with captcha enabled, there may be additional words or phrases that we would like to ban from being a possible from showing in the captcha check.
h1. Suggested Solution

Add a config file where words or phrases can be added that aren't currently covered by the captcha check
h1. Why this is important

There may be problematic words that are specific to a company/region using the application. Legal issues may also come up. This empowers admins and their ability to add safe and reliable user checks.

 
h1. Work-a-round

*This will require a shut down of your instance*

1) Navigate to  [<JIRA_INSTALL>|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/jira-application-installation-directory-861253887.html]/Users/username/deployments/jiraXXX/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/servlet/Language.properties

2) Edit  [<JIRA_INSTALL>|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/jira-application-installation-directory-861253887.html]/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/servlet/Language.properties to include phrases you deem unacceptable

**Please note,  this file is a blacklist of words which contains inappropriate language
fields.summary: Ability to add banned phrases to captcha

h3. Summary
When you attach any additional images after the first edit in Confluence page, all the latest images you attached will be appear as broken in JIRA activity stream

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.4 
* Confluence 6.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup application link between JIRA and Confluence via 2-legged OAuth
# Create a test page in Confluence and attach 3 images
# Refresh JIRA dashboard, all 3 images from the Confluence pages showing correctly in the JIRA activity stream
# Edit the existing test page in Confluence, add additional images, then save it

h3. Expected Results
The latest attached images shows correctly in JIRA activity stream

h3. Actual Results
The latest attached images appears to be broken in JIRA activity stream
 !Screen Shot 2017-04-13 at 5.02.36 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
When you mouse over the broken image, the URL seems to consist of double forward slash which is invalid, example:
{code}
http://localhost:8090/confluence//download/attachments/1015834/2014-bmw-m3-f30.png?version=1&modificationDate=1492074144633&api=v2

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user search result is truncated to the first 1000 users on the instance. For example: with parameters {{&startAt=0&maxResults=1000}} we get the first 1,000 users but setting {{&startAt=1001}} results in no users being returned. Using {{startAt=600}}, we only have 400 users returned.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.3 or latest

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 1,300 user in JIRA
# Send a GET HTTP request to the endpoint {{<JIRA-Base-URL>/rest/api/2/user/search?username=.&includeInactive=false&startAt=1001&maxResults=1000}}

h3. Expected Results
Return user 1001-1300 in the list

h3. Actual Results
No users are returned.

h3.Workaround
h5. If you exclusively require the use of REST API
You may stream users in batches based on a wildcard search for the string provided. For example, the following call will return the following test elements: 

https://HOST/rest/api/latest/user/search?username='123'&startAt=1&endAt=10&maxResults=10&order=key&includeInactive=true

# email= test123@gmail.com or email= 123email@gmail.com
# username = ab123  or username= 123ab
# displayname = ab123  or displayname= 123ab 

If any of those have more than 1000 results, search for 'aa', 'ab', etc...

h5. If it's feasible to query the database
You may retrieve similar information by querying the {{cwd_user}} table in JIRA's database.
fields.summary: User search startAt parameter is not working

fields.description:
_emphasized text_See JRASERVER-39866 for a background of this problem.

The problem is jTDS hasn't had a release since 2013 even though this specific bug affecting Java 8 and connecting to SQL Server over SSL has been committed to their repository.

Understanding that we are addressing this long-term by moving to Microsoft's SQL driver in future JIRA releases we are in need of a better solution in the meantime for current Enterprise customers on JIRA 7.2.8 wishing to connect to SQL Server over SSL

One can build the latest stable jTDS 1.3.1 driver in the following manner:
{code}
svn checkout https://svn.code.sf.net/p/jtds/code/branches/jTDS\ 1.3\ \(stable\) jtds-1.3
cd jtds-1.3
ant dist
{code}

Which only differs from the last release by a [few bugfixes|https://sourceforge.net/p/jtds/code/1290/log/?path=/branches/jTDS%201.3%20(stable)]

This request is for us the include the latest stable release of jTDS so we can run it through our QA and soke tests for JIRA 7.2.X while we wait for a future JIRA version that includes Microsoft's SQL driver
fields.summary: Include latest stable build of jTDS driver

fields.description:
h4. Problem
JIRA is comparing all project versions, including released/archived, when performing a JQL search with operators: < , > , <=, >=. This can result in expensive requests taking a long time to complete, exhausting thread pools.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
* Create multiple versions across multiple projects
* Archive and Release some versions
* Perform a JQL search for versions using one of the operators: < , > , <=, >=
** Example:
{code}
fixVersion < "Version 1"
{code}
** Note: trying to restrict the JQL to specific tickets/projects does not help

h4. Threads
Under high load, notice that majority of threads are stuck with a similar stack:
{code}
"http-nio-8081-exec-135" #165077 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007fabd4065000 nid=0x5a25 runnable [0x00007fa9580a2000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getIfPresent(LocalCache.java:3926)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.getIfPresent(LocalCache.java:4733)
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCachedReference.get(DelegatingCachedReference.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.project.CachingProjectManager.getProjectObj(CachingProjectManager.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.VersionImpl.getProjectObject(VersionImpl.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comparator.VersionComparator.compare(VersionComparator.java:24)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comparator.VersionComparator.compare(VersionComparator.java:8)
	at com.atlassian.query.operator.Operator$9$1.evaluate(Operator.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.EvaluateAllPredicate.evaluate(EvaluateAllPredicate.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.collect.CollectionUtil$GCollectPredicate.apply(CollectionUtil.java:424)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$7.computeNext(Iterators.java:652)
	at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.tryToComputeNext(AbstractIterator.java:143)
	at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.hasNext(AbstractIterator.java:138)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.RelationalOperatorIdIndexValueQueryFactory.generateRangeQueryForPredicate(RelationalOperatorIdIndexValueQueryFactory.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.RelationalOperatorIdIndexValueQueryFactory.generateQueryForValue(RelationalOperatorIdIndexValueQueryFactory.java:94)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.RelationalOperatorIdIndexValueQueryFactory.createQueryForSingleValue(RelationalOperatorIdIndexValueQueryFactory.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.GenericClauseQueryFactory.getQuery(GenericClauseQueryFactory.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.VersionCustomFieldClauseQueryFactory.getQuery(VersionCustomFieldClauseQueryFactory.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.ContextAwareQueryVisitor.visit(ContextAwareQueryVisitor.java:97)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.createLuceneQuery(LuceneSearchProvider.java:272)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHits(LuceneSearchProvider.java:210)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.gadgets.system.IssueTableResource.createResponse(IssueTableResource.java:479)
	at com.atlassian.jira.gadgets.system.IssueTableResource.getFilterTable(IssueTableResource.java:235)
...
{code}

h4. Debugger Details
With a debugger attached, we see that when JIRA reaches the {{RelationalOperatorIdIndexValueQueryFactory.generateRangeQueryForPredicate}}, it performs a {{domainObjects = resolver.getAll()}} which returns all versions in JIRA. See screenshot where the domainObjects contain all versions from JIRA, including versions from mutiple projects, archived, released, unreleased:
!domainObjects.png|thumbnail!
* JIRA then proceeds to compare every version in JIRA via the {{VersionComparator}}.
fields.summary: Expensive JQL When Comparing Versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a bypass connector or unproxied application link, the display and application URLs are different.  Confluence pages linked to JIRA issues will render the link with the application URL instead of the display URL if the user is not authenticated.

These links are likely not accessible by the end user.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.4
* Confluence 6.0.6
* Bypass connect or non-proxy url used for application link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an unproxied application link as described here: [How to create an unproxied application link - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-create-an-unproxied-application-link-719095740.html]
# View the page as a user who has not authenticated against confluence yet.

h3. Expected Results
The "Wiki Page" link should use the display url.

h3. Actual Results
The "Wiki Page" link uses the application url which should be internal only (note the URLs in the lower left corner):
 !Screen Shot 2017-04-12 at 2.17.50 PM.png|thumbnail! 

vs

 !Screen Shot 2017-04-12 at 2.17.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Authenticate and the display URL is used once the page information is retrieved from Confluence.

*Background*

Quick filters are great, we use them all the time.. but we often have to define them in pairs, filter 'X', and then filter 'not X'. What would be amazing is if there was an easy way in the UI to invert a quick filter. That way I can keep down the proliferation of quick filters.

fields.description:
h3. "Failed to start JIRA due to a build number inconsistency" when importing a Cloud backup to Server

h3. Environment

JIRA Server 7.3.x, JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Obtain an XML instance backup from JIRA Cloud
# Install latest version of JIRA Server
# Attempt import of Cloud backup to Server following the steps in [Migrating from JIRA Cloud to Server applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-802592270.html]

h3. Expected Results

Import is successful and JIRA starts normally following the import.

h3. Actual Results

The following error message is thrown:

{quote}
Failed to start JIRA due to a build number inconsistency.
The data present in your database is newer than the version of JIRA you are trying to startup.
Database build number: 100035
JIRA app build number: 73014
Please use the correct version of JIRA. You are running: 7.3.3#73014-sha1:d5be8da522213be2ca9ad7b043c51da6e4cc9754
{quote}

h3. Workaround

# Stop JIRA.
# Manually update the *jira.version.patched* property by directly modifying the database. 
{code}
UPDATE propertystring SET propertyvalue = '<server build number>' WHERE propertyvalue = '<cloud build number>';
{code}
For example, given the above build numbers:
{code}
UPDATE propertystring SET propertyvalue = '73014' WHERE propertyvalue = '100035';
{code}
# Start JIRA normally.
# Test to ensure everything works. 

h3. Notes 

Reference: [JIRA Build and Version Numbers Reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-build-and-version-numbers-reference-347341143.html]
fields.summary: "Failed to start JIRA due to a build number inconsistency" when importing a Cloud backup to Server

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if user export parent issues from JIRA to CSV and there are issues linked the parent issue, the status of the linked issues won't be exported.

Eg :

* Parent issue has 3 sub-tasks under {{In Progress}} status.
* Import parent issue and issue link will be imported but the status of the sub-tasks will not be imported.

Reason for this requirement:

Get a quick overview about tickets that have been forwarded for bug fixing to other teams. Only if their status is 'Done' or 'Closed' the originator team can start with Verification & Validation of the result.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for CSV export so the linked issue status can be exported.


h3. Workaround 

None

*Steps to replicate*

# Install  fresh Jira
# Install Crowd 2.11.x
# Create a few user in crowd *Internal directory*
# Configure Jira to use crowd as user management, with the crowd internal directory
# Login with the crowd user
# Set the alias user name in crowd (example: {{c2}} new alias {{c2a}})
# login with {{user1a}}
# Login was successful, all the group attached to the new aliased user name
# Perform a *FULL* synchronization for the crowd directory

*Expected Behavior*
All the groups will be remain under the user
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*Actual Behavior*
All the group was removed for the user 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

Below's error message found during the full synch
{noformat}
2017-04-11 20:57:17,994 Caesium-1-4 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] Could not add the following missing users to group [ confluence-administrators ]: [c2]
2017-04-11 20:57:18,013 Caesium-1-4 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] removed [ 1 ] user members from [ confluence-users ] in [ 19ms ]
2017-04-11 20:57:18,014 Caesium-1-4 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] Could not add the following missing users to group [ confluence-users ]: [c2]
2017-04-11 20:57:18,051 Caesium-1-4 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] removed [ 1 ] user members from [ jira-servicedesk-users ] in [ 37ms ]
2017-04-11 20:57:18,051 Caesium-1-4 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] Could not add the following missing users to group [ jira-servicedesk-users ]: [c2]
2017-04-11 20:57:18,073 Caesium-1-4 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] removed [ 1 ] user members from [ jira-software-users ] in [ 22ms ]
2017-04-11 20:57:18,074 Caesium-1-4 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] Could not add the following missing users to group [ jira-software-users ]: [c2]
{noformat}(!) Whenever a user trying to assign a task or project to the affected user, the user could not assign the task due to the permission

h4. Workarounds
h5. For JIRA versions before 7.3.x
No workaround presently available. 

h5. For JIRA 7.3.x+
Relogin with the user again, ensure that you've turned on the {{update group memberships when logging in}} to {{Every time the user logs in}}

In addition, set the *Sync Interval* for the Crowd Directory to be longer to avoid situations where a sync results in the aliased user's group memberships being reset while they are logged in.
fields.summary: Crowd Aliased user got removed from group after synchronization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an Admin, I have encountered errors related to [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/] plugins and add-ons when upgrading JIRA. As a troubleshooting step (in a test environment), I temporarily moved some plugin .jar files out of the installed-plugins directory, but it was not always clear which file related to which plugin.
h3. Suggested Solution

List the file names for each add-on/plugin .jar file on the *Manage add-ons* menu in JIRA and on the *JIRA update check*.
h3. Why this is important

Easily identifying add-ons and plugins by file name will save significant time in specifying a working upgrade process, especially when upgrading to a new major release.
fields.summary: Identify add-ons by file name

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Go to the "Releases" page for a project, e.g. that of the [JOHNSON project|https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/JOHNSON?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:release-page&status=released-unreleased].
 # Click the date picker icon for the "Release date" field and choose a single-digit date, i.e. from the 1st to the 9th of the month.
 # The picker dialog closes and the selected date is filled in, but there is a validation error saying "Please enter the date in the following format: dd/MMM/yyyy". Here's a screenshot:

!image-2017-02-20-09-38-01-704.png!

 

If you pick a two-digit date from the picker (i.e. the 10th of the month or later), then the error does not occur.

Also, if you get the error and change the single digit date to a two-digit date, the error does not go away until you click into a different field.
fields.summary: Choosing single-digit release date from date picker gives validation error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31487].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a blocking issue is resolved, all blocked issues should get notified of the change, so that people watching those issues can respond.


h3. Suggested Solution
There is no way to perform this natively in JIRA.
 
h3. Workaround 
The third party add-on [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview] (paid) provides a post-function for that: *Update blocking issues* ([source|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/builtin-scripts.html#_post_functions])
fields.summary: All clients need this: Notify blocked issues when blocker resolved

Same thing if we click on the "display projects" when editing the roles.

Please see on attached screenshots the difference between JIRA6 (was working fine) and JIRA7 (not displayed)

 

Regards

Gael

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As per the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/rich-text-editing-838542372.html], it mentions the following:
bq. The rich text editor is available on description fields, comment fields, and all Text field (multi line) custom fields that use the wiki renderer

However, when creating custom fields of type Text field (multi line) and performing a Bulk operation, the RTE is not enabled on the Move issues screen. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few Customfields of type *Text field(multi-line)* and associate them with a project. 
# Navigate to the Field Configurations, and make the newly created customfields '*Required*'
# Navigate to _System -> Rich Text editor_ and ensure that it is enabled. 
# Go to search for issues and filter out the specific project. 
# Click on *Tools* and Bulk Change
# Choose the issues then choose *Move Issues*
# At Step 3 you will be prompted to *Update Fields for Target Project* and this is where the Required CustomFields will appear

h3. Expected Results

The fields are displayed with RTE enabled. 

h3. Actual Results
The text fields are displayed as follows:
 !RTE-customfields.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
No current workaround available
fields.summary: Bulk Operation (Move issues) does not use the Rich Text editor for custom fields of type Text (multi-line)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing the instance health page, it will POST an AJAX request to execute the health checks. The instance health page will then periodically query the results to see what has completed and is supposed to update the page as this occurs.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Browse to the Instance Health Page
# Wait for health checks to complete

h3. Expected Results

As each check completes it is updated periodically to the page (as they run in an executor of 8 threads)

h3. Actual Results

The page waits until the one long running check (end of life in this case as 6.1 is unreleased) to complete until the other checks are updated in the page.

h3. Notes

It appears this is because we put all the checks into one 'process' and run them sequentially rather than in parallel as per the the intended design.
fields.summary: JIRA Instance Health plugin blocks on page load waiting for all checks to appear instead of displaying them as they complete

fields.description:
It would make it much more palatable to upgrade JIRA to gain desired new features if it were also possible to disable certain undesirable new features in recent versions. Atlassian has released several non-configurable "features" recently that are considered "bugs" by a significant subset of customers, e.g.:
 * New project navigation: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43288
 * Project admin workflow editing: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63684

Please consider supporting an "opt out" when developing new features for JIRA Server to let administrators pick and choose the new features that work best for their customers.
fields.summary: Allow administrators the option to disable newly released features

When the integrity checker finds problems related to a specific ticket in https://jira.atlassian.com/ it provides an issue key, e.g. JRA-4539

However since the recent forking of projects here, these keys are no longer valid.  The example above, for example, needs to be corrected to JRASERVER-4539

h3.Workaround
If not automatically redirected to the correct project, manually add the "SERVER" part to the link and continue to the expected issue.

French translation in CSAT is not so accurate

h3. Summary

While anonymising some entities.xml with [anonymising tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/anonymising-jira-data-139008.html], it sometimes shows error with invalid XML characters *^L*

Removing the invalid characters does not help with this as well. The characters seem to be separators for some mappings or relations, so they cannot be found in the entites,xml.


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.3


h3. Expected Results

The [invalid character removal tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/removing-invalid-characters-from-xml-backups-12079.html] should be able to remove the invalid character and anonymiser anonymise the backup.

h3. Actual Results

Anonymiser shows error related to characters *^L*.


h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Anonymizer tool throws "^L" invalid XML characters error

fields.description:
Many usecases for notifications and integration involve "alert me when X is finished" scenarios. However, Webhooks cannot subscribe to "issue_resolved" events. There are a number of workarounds for this, most of them relating to which workflow is used, adding post-functions and firing subscribable events (e.g. issue_updated). However, from an integration standpoint it would be very helpful to allow webhooks to subscribe to this (issue_resolved) event without having to modify/require specific workflow logic on the JIRA side, as the event is triggered. This could then also implicitly allow the same via the REST API (creating webhooks via API that subscribe to issue_resolved events).

Also, trying to support these usecases using webhooks with issue_updated or other events with JQL filters seems a lot less performant than having a webhook that only listens for issue_resolved.
fields.summary: Allow Webhooks to subscribe to issue_resolved
Image pasted in visual mode doesn't have 'thumbnail' property set

fields.description:
h3. URLs with accented characters are truncated by the visual comment editor
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.3 or 7.2.8 and Google Chrome, Firefox, IE 11
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View any issue
 # Ensure that the *Visual* editor is selected
 # Enter a URL with accented characters, for example: "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dáil_Éireann"
 # Select *Add*

h3. Expected Results
 * The text displayed is "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dáil_Éireann"
 * The URL href is "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dáil_Éireann" or "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/D%C3%A1il_%C3%89ireann"

h3. Actual Results
 * The text displayed is "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dáil_Éireann"
 * The hyperlink stops with the "D" character
 * The URL href is "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/D"

As seen: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dáil_Éireann
h3. Workaround

Use the *Text* editor when submitting the comment, or use the *Link icon* > *External link* function in the visual editor to
fields.summary: URLs with accented characters are truncated by the visual comment editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Assignee dropdown uses REST API: _/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search_
Searching assignable user though REST API: _/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=&project=<PROG>_ doesn't return expected number of *assignable* users. 

This is regression of new functionality introduced in JIRA 7.2: _in-memory Lucene index_  (Implemented as  {{IndexedUserDao.search}}, see JRASERVER-65126, JRASERVER-60532) 


h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.x 
* Large number of users: 1k+ 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure some small amount of user to be assignable for a specific project, eg: 3
# Trigger the REST call with expected _maxResults_:  _/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?project=<PROG>&maxResults=3
# Trigger the REST call with higher _maxResults_:  _/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?project=<PROG>&maxResults=4
#* Actual _maxResults_ value depends on specific data set 

h3. Expected Results
* REST call returns all expected *assignable* users. 
* Returned result set doesn't depend on _maxResults_
* Returned result set doesn't contain duplicates

h3. Actual Results
* REST doesn't return expected number of *assignable* users, less then expected
* Result set size depends on _maxResults_
* Sometimes returned result set contains duplicates
 
h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
(!)(x) It might cause performance degradation for large JIRA instances. Please be careful and rollback the change if it has significant performance impact.
To disable new in-memory Lucene index (JRASERVER-65126), JIRA will use SQL to search users after that:
# Add the following line to <JIRA_HOME>/jira-config.properties (create file if doesn't exist):
{code}jira.luceneUserSearcher = false{code}
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA Assignee dropdown doesn't return expected number of assignable users.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Performing a JIRA restore from an xml backup is failing with java.lang.NullPointerException when there is a long string in the field : {{'oldstring'}} for {{'changeitem'}} table. 
JIRA does not provide any helpful logging here to help determine why the restore failed. We need to have better logging for this failure.






h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restore a backup of JIRA from Administration > System > Restore System

h3. Expected Results
Restore finishes successfully

h3. Actual Results
Restore fails but without giving any reason why it failed
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}2017-04-05 17:34:16,441 http-nio-8351-exec-17 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/JSP-283501].[default]] Servlet.service() for servlet [default] in context with path [/JSP-xxxx] threw exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.JiraImportProgressFilter.doFilter(JiraImportProgressFilter.java:130)
	at com.atlassian.core.filters.AbstractHttpFilter.doFilter(AbstractHttpFilter.java:31)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:239)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:219)
	... 11 filtered
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745){noformat}
 


h3.Workaround
# Enable TRACE logging on the class {{'com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport'}} and {{'com.atlassian.jira.imports'}}
# Now start the restore
# When the restore fails, look through the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file to determine which record it was reading from {{entities.xml}}
# Open the {{entities.xml}} file to see that row. That should help to find where the restore is failing.

h3. Notes
The issue was mitigated in versions 7.3.7 and 7.4.0. Jira will now report any unexpected failure during data import
 that is from 20% to 90% of import progress. Problems that happen outside of this range can still be not printed in log. Example: out of memory during XML parsing.
fields.summary: JIRA Restore failing with java.lang.NullPointerException

h3. Environment

An instance that is being upgraded to JIRA Service Desk 7.2.1 (Service Desk 3.2.1).
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Using an XML backup that contains unexpected data in the nodeassoication table.
h3. Expected Results

The Upgrade Task should be able to avoid this situation.
h3. Actual Results

The upgrade fails and the JIRA Service Desk instance upgrade is blocked.
h3. Notes

It is recommended that you work with [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] to determine the best path forward with this solution at this stage. To workaround this issue, attempt to detect the entries causing this issue.
{code}
SELECT n.*
  FROM nodeassociation n
 WHERE n.sink_node_entity = 'PermissionScheme'
   AND source_node_id NOT IN (
		SELECT id
		  FROM project
       );

{code}
If this is the case, test removing these entries from an XML Backup (these entries will look like: {{<NodeAssocation sourceNodeId=...}}) and restore this data to the instance.
fields.summary: Unexpected Entries in the nodeassociation table cause JIRA Service Upgrade to fail

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As health checks can be run asynchronously in the background inside a scheduler, the return order can vary, as can the severity level. If a warning is returned for a category, and then a critical error it will show the category as warning rather than critical.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Execute the healthchecks such that a warning and critical is returned for the same category, as per the screenshot.
(i) This is easier to reproduce by preventing [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com] access so the End of Life check takes longer to run.

h3. Expected Results

The category has the highest warning level - in this case that is critical.

h3. Actual Results

The category uses the warning level that is returned first, as per the screenshot this is warning.
fields.summary: JIRA Instance Health does not display correct error level for category

fields.description:
Since JIRA 7.1.4, the default {{dbconfig.xml}} settings include: {code}<pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>{code} (described more in [Health Check: Database Connection Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/health-check-database-configuration-792636748.html])

However, in our documentation, examples for {{dbconfig.xml}} do not appear to have been updated to include this.

For example: 
* [Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL (7.3)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-861253043.html]
* [Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL (7.2)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-828787562.html]

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * A user reported us, after creating a table, that it appears without "table formatting" in the description field

h3. Steps to replicate
Scenario1:
# Go to Service Desk project - Queues
# Create an issue by choosing "Create" button
# Choose any project (not nessesarily Service Desk project) and any issue type
# Go to Description field and choose "Visual" view.
# Press "+" icon and add Table
# Add summary and other mandatory fields
# Press "Create" to save the issue
# View the issue.

Scenario2:
# Go to Service Desk project - Queues
# Open existing issue in the view
# Start to edit Description field (or create/edit a comment)
# Press "+" icon and add Table
# Save the update

h3. Expected Behavior
 * Issue shows a table in the description.

h3. Actual Behavior
 * Open created issue and sees a broken table
 ** First example: !Table is Broken.png|thumbnail!
 ** Second example: !JIRA Tables.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * Replicated with Google Chrome and Firefox.
 * Internet explorer seems to work properly.
 * The issue does not appear to be present in JIRA 7.4.0 (tested with Chrome 60.0.3112.90 (Official Build) )
fields.summary: Table format breaks

fields.description:
h3. (i) This is a clone of a Confluence bug that has proven to affect JIRA.
h3. Summary

Everywhere in Confluence DB tables, the creator is now set as the user hash. This username hash is stored in the table user_mapping which is made of three columns (user_key, username, lower_username). The last column has a unique index.

Now in cwd_user, there is no index on column lower_user_name. The only index there is on lower_user_name is composed with the other column directory_id.

So this means that for every action where Confluence looks up for creator information, it makes a full table scan on cwd_user. (Unless the caching in Confluence helps to avoid this ? )
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.9.4
 * PostgreSQL 9.3.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce

There are many actions in Confluence which could cause this to occur. One such query which has been found is the below one:
{code:sql}
select internalgr2_.id as id,
internalgr2_.group_name as group_name,
internalgr2_.lower_group_name as lower_gr3_,
internalgr2_.active as active,
internalgr2_.local as local,
internalgr2_.created_date as created_6_,
internalgr2_.updated_date as updated_7_,
internalgr2_.description as descript8_,
internalgr2_.group_type as group_type,
internalgr2_.directory_id as directo10_
from cwd_membership hibernatem0_,
cwd_user internalus1_,
cwd_group internalgr2_
where hibernatem0_.parent_id=internalgr2_.id
and ((internalus1_.lower_user_name=:v2 and hibernatem0_.child_user_id=internalus1_.id)
and(internalgr2_.directory_id=:v1 and hibernatem0_.parent_id=internalgr2_.id))
order by internalgr2_.lower_group_name;
{code}
An explain plan on that shows a table scan is run on the lower_user_name field in cwd_user, if there is enough data in the tables being queried (in a fresh install there is no table scan, probably due to optimization from analyze statistics).
h3. Expected Results

Database query returns quickly without performance impact, by using an index lookup.
h3. Actual Results

Database query returns slowly, and causes a performance hit, as it's using a record lookup (table scan).
h3. Workaround

Manually add an index on lower_user_name in the cwd_user table, for example:
{code:sql}
create index idx_user_lower_user_name on cwd_user (lower_user_name);
{code}
NOTE: If any future fix adds a new index, you may need to manually remove this index before that.
fields.summary: cwd_user table missing a index

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in JIRA, Administrators can perform tasks without needing approval from System Administrator. This could result in other Administrator making changes (such as removing field used in multiple projects) and causing problem with multiple projects.

Due to the JIRA's permission mode, Administrator privilege is neccesary to manage some aspect of the project such as scheme configuration.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add some type of approval method in JIRA.

Eg:

# Fillter by changes from a day X
# Filter by changes by certain user
# Roll back Administrator's all selected change

This means every change done by regular Administrator will require approval from System Administrator. 


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Allow JIRA System Administrator to manage changes by JIRA Administrator

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA or JSD, when a mail cannot be correctly processed to a new ticket or a new comment, an error will be logged in the incoming mail log (or in the mail audit table for JSD), but the user will not be aware of this error. So for the user it seems that his/her mail is received and processed correctly by JIRA until administrator noticed these errors in the log.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a feature in JIRA and in JSD to alert the user when the mail is not processed correctly.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to notify/alert user when incoming mails cannot be processed correctly

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

*BACKGROUND*

My team work a lot with Epics, and one thing we do every week is tally up all the Story points for all stories in the Epic.  Given the entire team create stories in real time off Epics during refinement meetings, sometimes we end up with 20-30 stories under an Epic at the end of the meeting.

Our Product owner manually tallies the Stories we estimate in his spreadsheet, however, we generally only point ~20% of all the Stories we create at the time we create them.  As we progressively pick up the stories, the team refines and estimates them.  E.g. we know we will need to do Story X, however, we're not going to estimate it's size until we actually need to begin development in earnest.

The Product Owner is constantly having to manually click into each Story and note the points (which the team can change outside of refinement, as we update points estimates, and also as we split stories which become more troublesome as we work on them) so, it's a constant whack-a-mole for the PO and Scrum Master.

*SUGGESTION*

*MVP:*
 # Display Story Points next to each Story item in the "Issues in Epic" list inside the Epic

*Nice to Have*
 # Create option to configure whether to display Story points next to each Story
 # Create option to Display a tally of all Story points totals underneath, or above, the list of Stories.
fields.summary: Issues in Epic list - show Story points next to all Stories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Following the implementation to have shared filters and dashboards to be shared to _only_ logged-in user in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23255 the existing filters/dashboards shared continue to stay public.

This is expected as per the description
{quote}
Allows users to share dashboards and filters with all users including those that are not logged in. Disabling this will not change sharing for dashboards and filters that are already shared with the public. See related [knowledge base article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Anonymous+users+able+to+see+shared+filters+dashboards+or+project+issues].
{quote}

h5. Use-case problem
Users that tries to save Public filter after disabling Public sharing will hit into an error below
!savefilter.png|thumbnail!

Error is unclear and only can be understood when the said user go to _Details > Edit Permission_ where it now show below
!editperm.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Have options when disabling this to have _all_ shared dashboards/filters that were shared to Public now updates to Logged-in users only.

h3. Why this is important
The error to users are not clear of what needed to be done and this would help solves user and administrators concern.
 
h3. Workaround 
(!) Create a database and XML backup first!
# Shutdown JIRA
# Create a database backup
# Run the following to update filters
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
update SHAREPERMISSIONS
SET SHARETYPE = 'loggedin'
WHERE SHARETYPE = 'global' AND entitytype = 'SearchRequest';
{code}
# Run the following to update dashboards
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
update SHAREPERMISSIONS
SET SHARETYPE = 'loggedin'
WHERE SHARETYPE = 'global' AND entitytype = 'PortalPage' AND id !=10000;
{code}
# Start up JIRA
# [Re-index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/search-indexing-861253852.html] Jira.
fields.summary: Options to automatically make all Public filters and dashboards to Logged-in users

h3. Expected Results

{quote}
JIRA version <version> is approaching End Of Life. Please plan to upgrade JIRA within <n> days.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results

{quote}

This only applies for the warning error text.
fields.summary: End of Life health check incorrectly lists Confluence instead of JIRA in the failure reason.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Improve the way JIRA handles emails when there are slow transfer speeds between the application server and the mail server to avoid duplicate issues being created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # N/A can be hard to replicate as this is directly correlated to the transfer speeds between JIRA and the SMTP server. Note that this can happen with small files (2 MB) taking up top 30 mins to attach to JIRA, so not necessarily related to size. In other words, the duplicates were traced down to slow transfer speeds.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA will handle IMAP emails without creating duplicate issues, regardless of transfer speeds.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA can create multiple duplicate tickets for the same email

Here's an example of 4 tickets created from the same email. Note the different Caesium threads and that attachments were added to different tickets:
{code:java}
2017-03-14 14:09:18,172 | INFO | Caesium-1-3 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-3 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Added comment 'An error occurred... 'by 'anonymous' to issue 'HYPE-452'

2017-03-14 14:09:17,870 | ERROR | Caesium-1-3 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-3 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | Exception while adding attachments to HYPE-452. Some attachments from the message might be missing. Making a note on the issue. | 

2017-03-14 14:09:16,182 | INFO | Caesium-1-2 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-2 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Added comment 'An error occurred... 'by 'anonymous' to issue 'HYPE-453' | 

2017-03-14 14:09:15,788 | ERROR | Caesium-1-2 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-2 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | Exception while adding attachments to HYPE-453. Some attachments from the message might be missing. Making a note on the issue. | 
java.io.IOException: Error while reading attachment, resulting file was incomplete and has been removed.


2017-03-14 14:09:09,789 | INFO | Caesium-1-1 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-1 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Added comment 'An error occurred... 'by 'anonymous' to issue 'HYPE-451' | 

2017-03-14 14:09:09,178 | ERROR | Caesium-1-1 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-1 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | Exception while adding attachments to HYPE-451. Some attachments from the message might be missing. Making a note on the issue.
{code}
{code:java}
2017-03-14 14:08:59,766 | INFO | Caesium-1-3 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-3 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Added attachment to issue 'HYPE-450' | 
2017-03-14 13:17:57,182 | INFO | Caesium-1-2 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-2 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Added attachment to issue 'HYPE-453' | 
2017-03-14 13:17:40,013 | INFO | Caesium-1-2 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-2 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Issue HYPE-453 created | 
2017-03-14 12:33:11,822 | INFO | Caesium-1-3 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-3 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Added attachment to issue 'HYPE-452' | 
2017-03-14 12:32:54,400 | INFO | Caesium-1-3 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-3 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Issue HYPE-452 created | 
2017-03-14 11:41:23,784 | INFO | Caesium-1-1 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-1 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Added attachment to issue 'HYPE-451' | 
2017-03-14 11:41:09,903 | INFO | Caesium-1-1 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-1 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Issue HYPE-451 created | 
2017-03-14 10:00:01,247 | INFO | Caesium-1-3 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-3 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Added attachment to issue 'HYPE-450' | 
2017-03-14 09:59:45,760 | INFO | Caesium-1-3 | [JIRA] | Caesium-1-3 | anonymous |  |  |  | user | user[15100]: Issue HYPE-450 created | {code}
h3. Suggestion

This was resolved by applying a patch on the SMTP server to improve transfer speeds (this was provided on the SMTP side). However, JIRA should have better handling for IMAP email handling to avoid this behavior:
 # Better logs suggesting this is what's happening
 # Better logic to handle long processing emails without creating duplicates using IMAP
fields.summary: Improve the way JIRA handles emails when there are slow transfer speeds between the application server and the mail server to avoid duplicate issues being created

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When modifying an Advanced Search JQL and choosing an autocomplete suggestion (e.g., a custom field), if you do not enter both ""(quotes) before selecting the item from the auto-complete suggestions *all subsequent clauses* are removed from the query.

Adding the closing quote does prevent the deletion of all subsequent clauses, but it also leads to a partial overwrite of the existing clauses (the same number of characters as the drop-down suggestion, in fact).
h3. Environment

Reproducible in 7.3+.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform an Advanced Search with JQL (*Example:* {{project = test and issuetype = Task}})
 # Modify the search to add a custom field parameter prior to the last clause (*Example:* {{project = test and "My Field" = Foo and issuetype = Task}})
 # When attempting this, notice that the issuetype clause is removed from the query

h3. Expected Results

It is expected that selecting the item from the auto-complete suggestion list will add it to the query without impacting subsequent clauses.  
h3. Actual Results

The actual results are that all subsequent clauses are lost from the query. 
h3. Notes

It looks like this functionality was [added in JIRA Agile 6.1.3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Software%3A+How+to+search+for+a+Sprint+using+JQL]  The problem is not reproducible from this version through, at least, 7.2.7.  
h3. Workaround

Adding both an opening and closing quote before entering the item name and selecting from the auto-complete suggestion list will persist the subsequent clauses.
fields.summary: Subsequent JQL clauses deleted in Advanced Search when choosing an auto-complete suggestion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA support specifically 4 types of connections:

# PLAIN
# LOGIN
# NTLM

If user's server does not support these connection methods, connecting JIRA from the server to Mail Server will fail since JIRA will specifically look for the supported type of connections:

{code:java}
2017-04-03 14:54:44,296 DEBUG [JiraIncomingMail] https-jsse-nio-9001-exec-3 vshanmugam 894x1332x1 1ys7ish 10.0.1.3,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/VerifyPopServerConnection!update.jspa DEBUG IMAPS: mechanism PLAIN not supported by server
2017-04-03 14:54:44,296 DEBUG [JiraIncomingMail] https-jsse-nio-9001-exec-3 vshanmugam 894x1332x1 1ys7ish 10.0.1.3,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/VerifyPopServerConnection!update.jspa DEBUG IMAPS: mechanism LOGIN not supported by server
2017-04-03 14:54:44,296 DEBUG [JiraIncomingMail] https-jsse-nio-9001-exec-3 vshanmugam 894x1332x1 1ys7ish 10.0.1.3,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/VerifyPopServerConnection!update.jspa DEBUG IMAPS: mechanism NTLM not supported by server
2017-04-03 14:54:44,296 DEBUG [JiraIncomingMail] https-jsse-nio-9001-exec-3 vshanmugam 894x1332x1 1ys7ish 10.0.1.3,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/VerifyPopServerConnection!update.jspa DEBUG IMAPS: mechanism XOAUTH2 disabled by property: mail.imaps.auth.xoauth2.disable
{code}


h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for other types of login such as CRAM-MD5 


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Add support for CRAM-MD5 based login

fields.description:
Hi,

Recently we had a customer ticket that mentions there are 2 conflicting documentation articles about the JIRA DB connection setting: "*Test While Idle".*

We need to make it more clear in the article: [Tuning database connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Tuning+database+connections#Tuningdatabaseconnections-settingsConnectionpoolsettings] that this setting is not only set to true for MySQL database, but also can be set to true for other databases.

My customer read this article and thought that this setting is only for MySQL, although it applies to all JIRA supported DBs.

There is another document [Surviving connection closures|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Surviving+connection+closures] that has more detail description about this DB connection setting, we could also refer to it in the [Tuning database connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Tuning+database+connections#Tuningdatabaseconnections-settingsConnectionpoolsettings]  article.

 

Best Regards,

Sherif
fields.summary: Need more clarification on "Test While Idle" connection setting in article:Tuning database connections

Kyle has requested that I submit the following changes.

 

On the below URL, there are a few typos

[https://www.virtuox.net/Services/VirtuSOMInsomniaTesting]

 

*we want to delete the following:*

*Are There Other Consequences?*

The most immediate effect of sleep apnea is the daytime fatigue and risk of falling asleep at work or while driving. Other potential effects of sleep apnea include serious health problems such as high blood pressure, heart problems, diabetes and stroke. It can also lead to depression, irritability, sexual dysfunction, learning and memory difficulties. Studies show that up to 50 percent of sleep apnea sufferers have high blood pressure. Studies show that up to 70% of sleep apnea sufferers have diabetes

 

*We want to replace with:*
h2. *Are There Other Consequences?*

The most immediate effect of sleep apnea is the daytime fatigue and risk of falling asleep at work or while driving. Other potential effects of sleep apnea include serious health problems such as high blood pressure, heart problems, diabetes and stroke. It can also lead to depression, irritability, sexual dysfunction, learning and memory difficulties. Studies show that up to 50 percent of sleep apnea sufferers have high blood pressure. Studies show that up to 70% of sleep apnea sufferers have diabetes.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65005].
  {panel}

As an issue creator, I want to avoid unnecessary keyboard and mouse operations when entering issues.  

JIRA 7.2.4, Chrome 56.0.2924.87
h3. Current behavior
 * Enter some text
 * Select some or all of it with mouse or keyboard
 * Press Ctrl-K to create an external link
 * {color:#ff0000}Select dummy URL with mouse or keyboard{color}
 * Type or paste-in correct URL
 * Resume editing rest of sentence

h3. Desired Behavior
 * Enter some text
 * Select some or all of it with mouse or keyboard
 * Press Ctrl-K to create an external link
 * {color:#14892c}Dummy URL is automatically selected by editor{color}
 * Type or paste-in correct URL
 * Resume editing rest of sentence

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65004].
  {panel}

h2. Problem statement
At the moment, when cloning an issue, the reporter of the cloned issue will follow the reporter of the original issue. It will need to be done manually if users would like to change the reporter to a different user.

h2. Suggestion
It would great if JIRA could provide an option to change the reporter of the cloned issue before the operation - e.g:
* Option 1: keep the reporter
* Option 2: change to: current user / ________ (user picker field)
fields.summary: Provide the option to change the reporter when cloning issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65003].
  {panel}

*Summary*

As peer [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-FixVersionfixVersionFixversion], *NOT IN* and *IN* should work for:

* releasedVersions()
* latestReleasedVersion()
* unreleasedVersions()
* earliestUnreleasedVersion()

However, *NOT IN* and *IN* operators not working for latestReleasedVersion() and earliestUnreleasedVersion().

*Steps to Reproduce*

Try to perform a JQL search calling latestReleasedVersion() and earliestUnreleasedVersion() using NOT IN and IN operators.

*Expected Results*

Find the issues that matches the filter.

*Actual Results*

Get message like this:

\{code}Operator 'in' does not support the non-list value 'earliestUnreleasedVersion()' for field 'fixVersion'.\{code}

*Workaround*

Use operators *=* and *!=* instead of *NOT IN* and *IN*.
fields.summary: NOT IN and IN operators not working for latestReleasedVersion() and earliestUnreleasedVersion()
agro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-65001].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you click the edit button and make multiple changes, not all of these changes are reflected in the triggered email. An example is when changing the description, assignee and adding an attachment, it triggers the *issue assigned* email instead of *issue updated*

h3. Environment
* JIRA Version 6.4
* JIRA Version 7.3.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Click *Edit button* for the created issue and changes assignee, description and other fields
# Wait for JIRA to send notification

h3. Expected Results
Issue Updated notification is send as multiple field is editted.

h3. Actual Results
Issue assigned event is triggered and only changes for this field is notified while other field are ignored.
 
h3. Notes
This behaviour only happens when assignee field is editted together with other field.

h3.Workaround
Edit Assignee using the *Assign Button* and other fields using *Edit Button*
fields.summary: Editing Issue Using Edit Button Triggers Issue Assigned Event Instead of Issue Updated if We Make Changes In Assignee Field as Well

fields.description:
Investigating REST API failures as described here:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/CreateIssueMeta+returns+Duplicate+Key+error]

It was revealed certain plugins will add the same custom field to multiple tabs in JIRA's screen scheme configuration. This only becomes a problem in recent JIRA versions.

Currently it is not possible to add a field to multiple tabs in the UI or via REST

 

*Workaround*

Please refer the documentation page for the workaround https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/CreateIssueMeta+returns+Duplicate+Key+error
fields.summary: Prevent the same custom field from being added to multiple screen tabs in JIRA's Java API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64996].
  {panel}

It would be helpful to be able to set up the backlog page to first order the listed issues in sprints by status, then to be able to drag/drop them into a custom order.

 

Issues as they are now: (O - Open / C - Closed) The numbers here are just a way to identify which issue is which and not to depict a priority/rank.
5 - C
4 - C
6 - O
7 - O
1 - O
3 - C
2 - O

WIth the suggestion implemented, the issues would order themselves like this: (All Closed are at bottom and open at the top.)
6 - O
7 - O
1 - O
2 - O
3 - C
5 - C
4 - C

From here, I can drag/drop the OPEN issues to change rank. The closed issues would remain in place.
1 - O
2 - O
6 - O
7 - O
3 - C
5 - C
4 - C
fields.summary: All for dragging/dropping sprint backlog issues AFTER ordered by status
